result.execSummary:
The defendant James Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $300+ costs = $831. The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non Payment will result in entry of a civil judgment.
The Court requires the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

[ma] Case called at 10:18 AM 
Defendant James Clark in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for James Clark.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $300+ costs = $831. The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non Payment will result in entry of a civil judgment. 

The Court requires the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.
